covered: Valid Deletion Scenarios: TC01, TC02, TC03, and TC20 demonstrate 204 responses and status changes with various optional parameters.
Soft Delete Verification: Accounts moved to closed state as per TC01, TC06, and TC11.
Idempotence on non-existent or already-closed accounts: TC11 and TC12 show no changes and 204.
Comprehensive Parameter Handling: Default, all-true, all-false, per-parameter tests (TC01-05, TC13).
Error Handling and Security: Input validation (TC08), header validation (TC09), authentication handling (TC10), system error (TC14), SQL injection (TC15), and XSS (TC16).
Performance/Load and Concurrency: Large dataset management (TC07) and concurrent closures (TC18).
Regression and Backwards Compatibility: Unpaid invoices regression (TC19) and old-client compatibility (TC20).
Security and Accessibility: Security tests (TC15, TC16) and documentation accessibility (TC21).
Resilience: Timeout/retry case (TC17) ensures idempotence on transient failures.
gaps: Single-resource concurrency race condition not explicitly tested (two simultaneous deletes on the same account).
403 Forbidden coverage for insufficient permissions is not tested (only 401).
Caching behavior validation on DELETE responses (ETag/Cache-Control) not tested.
recommendations: Add a scenario for concurrent deletion of the same account to exercise race conditions and locking behavior.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario to cover insufficient privileges.
Add tests to validate caching headers on DELETE responses (ETag/Cache-Control).
Add rate-limiting tests for DELETE requests to ensure resilience under bursts.
